name: Strawberry Shake Philodendron
climate: Prefers warm temperatures between 65-80°F (18-27°C) for thriving.
Does not tolerate cold drafts; avoid placing near open windows in winter.
Tends to grow well in moderately humid environments, around 60% humidity.
Flourishes indoors as it mimics its naturally sheltered, tropical habitat.
sunlight: Thrives best in bright, indirect sunlight; direct sun may harm leaves.
Can tolerate lower light levels, but growth may be slower and leggier.
Avoid direct southern sunlight exposure to reduce leaf scorch risk.
Artificial grow lights can be used to supplement natural light indoors.
watering: Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings to prevent root rot.
Overwatering can lead to yellowing leaves; adjust frequency as needed.
Ensure pot has drainage holes to keep soil from staying overly wet.
Frequency of watering is variable; increase during growing season.
soil: Prefers a well-draining potting mix containing peat and perlite for aeration.
Soil should retain some moisture but must not remain waterlogged.
A mix of orchid bark can enhance drainage and provide root support.
Aim for soil with a slightly acidic to neutral pH for optimal nutrition.
toxic: All parts of the plant are toxic if ingested, especially to pets and children.
Contains calcium oxalate crystals, which can cause irritation if eaten.
extra_care_tip: Regular leaf cleaning can prevent dust buildup and encourage photosynthesis.
Propagation can be done via stem cuttings; allow cuts to callous before planting.
